text: They question why you're coming in when you walk in the door by security people when you have appointments. Then you have the parking meters that people have trouble using, you can't use debit, just credit or have to use the change side, so not only do you have to find an ATM but you have to get change for a $20 bill. They need to update this system so people are able to use either credit or debit we are in 2024 not 1990s not impressed with this place. The good side tho is friendly people. I also noticed that they charge way more at this time than any other, and are not as friendly either.

Brought my son to this Urgent care because the clinic we went to took X-rays of my sons finger and then phoned to let us know that it was fractured and to go to Urgent care to get a splint or anything else he might need. So we came to urgent care and the nurse(Blonde, glasses) who triaged him was not very nice. When my son told her that he hurt his finger and how the clinic told him to come to urgent care she raised her eyebrows and questioned him as to why he came after he had just told her why. She made him feel like he shouldn't have come here.  My son sat down and said why did we come here. This is the worst interaction from a nurse we have ever received. We will not be coming back to this Urgent care hospital again. We come for care not to be made feel unwanted by nurses who obviously don't like their job.

What kind of emergency or medical facility is it. Just one doctor in emergency ward during Night shifts. Do something better. People are sick, getting seizures while waiting. It’s more than 6 hours  while waiting to see doctor but nothing. It’s Canada we are getting worst medical services.
Doesn’t recommend this place. I think management doesn’t even care to put more doctors at emergency wards during nights. Shameful

Sitting in the back waiting for a doctor to come see me. After 45 minutes of waiting, they asked me to leave since I've been discharged. Wasn't registered in the back or seen a doctor. just nothing but attitude from the nurses and doctors. This hospital will always be known as 7 jokes. Winnipeg health care system is a joke.

Worst service!!!! This is called as urgent care but nothing here is considered as urgent. I have been waiting here for 6 hours and I haven’t been seen by doctor yet. The reason of my visit today was there were 4 stitches made on my finger due to a deep cut. It was done by two of the medical students without the supervision of doctor. I dont think that any experiments should be made on someone’s injury. Doctor should treat instead of medical students. One of my Sitches was placed wrong and I had to come again to get it placed right. This is totally unacceptable and if you go to triage nurses for asking wait time they would respond. I don’t know you have to wait beacuse you cut yourself. No, I didn’t cut myself it was an workplace accident. Treat someone with empathy and respect if you are frustrated with your job just leave…

Such a bad service!!! I have waited for 7 hours and still there was no doctor come to check me up. The nurses inside the patient ward were talking non stop and laughing while other people were suffering through their hard time. Also, they don’t have manners how to treat the patients. The screen was showing 5 hours wait time but nurses said sometimes it also takes up to 18 hours and nobody was telling us when the doctor will see us!! Her wording was that there is only one doctor right now and it’s very busy so no idea when she will see you, I don’t think so it’s a right way to tell your patients!!!!!!!

I had to bring my daughter for a procedure and had to use the public parking.
When we got inside and went to the pay station, a gentleman volunteer asked if I needed assistance.
He then asked if we knew where to register etc.  He actually showed us the way,all the while chatting with us.
All the volunteers are so friendly and helpful!
The Cafe makes a great clubhouse!

Came to urgent care at 6:30 pm left at 3:30 am... when I came in I had trouble breathing because my tonsils were taking up most of my throat, nobody looked at my tonsils even after I asked and I got put behind many people and had to wait much longer than the posted time and I even asked multiple times where I was on the wait list and they said "next" then called multiple other people in first, even though they wouldn't even properly assess my issue at triage, and was told it  was because the other people needed beds and I needed a chair then I proceeded to get put into a bed for 3 hours, got told multiple times my condition was my own fault by nurses because I had eaten or drank something that affected the "absorption of my medication" which was antibiotics for a condition I didn't even actually have as I was misdiagnosed originally, and heard nurses make fun of other patients for being "attention seeking" or "overdramatic"  after asking multiple times over the three hours I waited to see a doctor in the bed was told "there's only one doctor but there's only 4 people ahead of you" only got told right at 3am after i basically completely broke down crying because of how tired i was getting absolutely no help and no updates that I had mono, I was sent home.
Never coming back.

For some reason they keep deleting the review my girlfriend posts multiple times so maybe if you have shame over a true experience you should fix your system

I went in for a painful abscess last year. I was assessed quickly & the wait was about 2.5 hours which isn’t too bad. I was offered Tylenol for the pain by the front desk. Dr. Hunt drained my abscess & he had great bedside manner. He made sure I was comfortable & answered all my questions. No issues!

This week I had a procedure with the Seven Oaks Endoscopy Unit! The team was fantastic. It started with me being greeted by Maria. I had not registered yet so Maria walked me back to the entrance to show me where to go to register. SO Nice!, then Connie got me ready and into my bed with a warm blanket! So darn nice, friendly and gracious. Next I got spicy Maria! I loved this lady! she was funny and caring and so darn thorough! Nothing was left undiscussed. (Her interaction with the gentleman next to me was equally wonderful and funny. Into the room exactly on time, my procedure nurse took me to Dr Muthias, I m sorry I forgot the in room nurse names..  Suffice to say they were equally amazing. 10 acres of grass!!! she will know!  Dr Muthias is a GEM! All Drs should copy him. Thank you Thank you Thank you Seven Oaks.

I come here 4 days a week for dialysis. I usually try to arrive earlier to enjoy a Tms Coffee and Doughnut. I start my dialysis for 6pm. I usually arrive at SOGH around 4:30pm when Tim's is closing. I get a sandwich from the food dispenser. Problem is my sandwich was stale.  What is with that. I was looking forward to my sandwich for supper before my dialysis appointment. I cannot get coffee here without bringing my own cup first. Make sure you arrive here before Tim's closes at 4:30pm.z

I would have give 0 starts if possible.
Waiting time 12 hours, my husband got his ankle injured no fracture, the doctor even was not able to say how worse was the sprain, or what grade stage it was the injury.  His ankle got even more swollen and bruised. if you have something urgent do not come to this hospital. Attention it is a mess seems like just one doctor to see  critical patients  and the other ones at the same time.

Been here just over an hour now and so far so very good!
Nice, cheerful and professional nurses at the registration counters, and the nurse that did my bloodwork was very nice. I am thankful for the warm and caring atmosphere.

Arrived at 7pm with chest pain and difficulty breathing. It’s 3:15am and still have not seen a doctor. This place is an absolute joke.

Update: it’s now almost 6:30am and I’ve only had an X-ray and nobody has come to see me since. We are almost at 12 hours with no care provided.

Not user friendly to those with mobility issues.  They refused to give me room number of a patient.  I said I needed to know how far I would have to walk to get there and they would not tell me.  So, if you have mobility issues, don't bother visiting people there.

I don’t normally take time out of my day to write reviews but this place is absolutely brutal. I arrived at 8 pm and the wait time stated 5.5 hours. I understand that higher priority patients exist but I was seen 13 hours later. After waiting way too long to be seen, the doctor (who just started at this time) walks in and her demeanour was terrible. She asked such strange and condescending questions. Barely acknowledged the pain I was in or offered anything helpful aside from strong pain medications and a shot. Any other solution that I left with were self led recommendations made by myself. I would highly suggest avoiding this place if you can.
Staff were kind and patient (also apologetic for the wait)....other than enduring the 5 hours, I haven't had a terrible experience at this hospital 😊 …

If you wanna die this is the place to come too. Slowest nurses and Dr's I've ever seen. No care or empathy for patients. Stay away from this monstrosity. Told the nurses multiple time of unbearable pain and they did nothing about it.

Terrible service, after waiting hours my partners name was called to be helped and we got put in an open room in the back with multiple people laying on the floor and groaning. The doctors were sitting behind the desk laughing and making jokes about it saying they had no where else. Before calling patients back make sure you have space for them. It was so disappointing and disrespectful. Urgent care is an absolute joke.

Seven Oaks Urgent Care is a disgusting joke - I wish I could give it a zero rating. I saw nothing to give me any confidence that anyone here knows what they are doing - either the nurses or the security. All of them were nothing but rude and uncaring to the many patients that were made to wait for many hours. A large puddle of something (could have been anything!) was spilled from a bag being held by another patient right under the chair where my mother was left to sit uncomfortably for hours, and nobody made any effort to clean it up despite being notified about it being there. The entire waiting area was grungy and dirty; the pop machine was broken; the one treatment room off of the waiting room was freezing (and another patient was abandoned in there in a gown for about 20?minutes before they finally had to come out to warm up!). I’m glad I don’t live in Winnipeg so I will never need to come here again, and I’m sorry for any patients that do need to come here.

The urgent care doctors were horrible, rude and disrespectful. I have never been treated that badly by two doctors in my entire life, I asked would you please listen to me and he said no you’re not listening to me a walked out of the room.   They expected to treat me with medication that would make my health worse and cause further problems. . The nursing staff were good except one who disagreed with a very viable fact several times.
Treated very poorly.

SOGH Urgent “Care” is an abysmal and soul crushing experience for people in pain. Go elsewhere. So far it has taken more than 8 hours for my daughter to be permitted entry into the patient care area only to discover she was only led to a second waiting room. How long she will have to yet wait to be seen by medical staff remains unclear. We asked two questions of registration staff during our more than 8 hours and each time we were met with snide looks and discourteous comments. Meanwhile we observed hospital staff engaging in PDA in the registration office area, in full view of waiting patients. What a horribly run and rude facility and staff. Every walk-in clinic experience I have had to date has provided a vastly superior experience to SOGH Urgent Care.
After waiting 6 hours the nurse informed me they didnt have any womens health providers on site and only could offer blood tests for infection

Tried to park & Pay my Fee but parking machines don’t let you use coins. Tried yesterday as-well?
Security told me impark controls tickets, gave me a card to call. But I’m now trying to bust my uncle…
I will just park in the Malls across the street!

Staff is very rude. ( the front registration and nurses )

I mean patients need a bit of sympathy as they are already tensed. Staff here makes a person more sick, they are RUTHLESS.

They were literally laughing at patient. Made me so furious.

Go change your profession if you can’t do it properly.

I wish I had enough money to sue you all guys. But, dont worry folks GOD witnesses everything and actions accordingly
Worst experience! Sister MARY JANE was very rude, I don’t think they deserve to be nurse by the way they treating people, took 11 hrs just to see a doc. Sucked!

DISGUSTING JOKE. If I could leave negative stars I WOULD!!! There was old pizza on the floor to start. Does seven oaks even have a cleaning staff??? Just absolutely disgusting environment. Worst of all they had 2 people in recliner chairs RIGHT by the door when you walk in. One of them was profusely coughing and dry heaving. This person they let sit there for HOURS. I’m now sick with the flu because of this and all I did was walk by them. Whose idea was  that to put those people there??? Seven oaks is not only disgusting but lacks any kind of empathy or care. If you cared you wouldn’t put 2 very sick people by the entry way where there are high risk people walking through?? I will be sharing my experience everywhere I can. DO NOT GO HERE.

Had an accident and fractured my elbow and I'm very grateful I was taken to Seven Oaks emergency where I received outstanding care throughout. Excellent facilities and professional and helpful staff . My doctor in particular was great, super knowledgeable, professional and friendly. FIVE STARS! Thank you!

12 + hours at this hospital.  Nurse in urgent basically detering ppl from coming - warning of a 9 hour wait.  I got here at 5 pm... it's 6:16 am. Was told there is only 1 doctor for the entire hospital.  I should have went elsewhere.
This hospital is terrible.   There's a woman sleeping on the cold floor and no one has checked on her.
I'm tired - mad - in pain.

My roommate and I walked into urgent care at 12:45 a.m. and we walked out at 5:30 a.m. without being seen. My roommate was in debilitating pain from his headache and, in turn, it made him incredibly nauseous. I had gone to the triage nurse multiple times to tell him about my roommate's increasingly worsening condition and was met with vague responses and disbelief. We constantly were checking the wait times and we had been waiting far longer than what was being posted. My roommate, through his pain, told me that the triage nurse was staring at him as if he didn't believe that he was as sick as he was. We gave up trying to see a doctor and went home.

This is absolutely disgusting behaviour from the staff at the hospital and, quite frankly, extremely upsetting as neither my roommate or myself have any trust in the medical sector in this city.

Do better.

With a lack of walk-ins open on Sunday, We came to urgent care to address a medical problem for my wife. She has not been able to eat or drink or sleep in over 24hrs most likely due to an infection. With a total inability to swallow food and drink we thought it was urgent enough to warrant a visit. After waiting an hour, We were shoved in a tiny corner room with 5 chairs, and 4 other people. We have been here over 4 hours with NOT ONE nurse checking in on us. We arrived at 7:30 am and the wait time said average of  2.75 hrs. When we approached the desk to ask for an explanation on what this side room and the process is, we were blatantly ignored. We have not even been acknowledged. The care here is so lacking, it may be safer to stay home.
UPDATE: my wife was able to find an open walk-in down the street, after 5.5 hours we walked out and went there.

They treat you worse than a dog. Broken shoulder hanging by the thread and got told to sit down and wait, passed out few times due to extreme pain and asked for water they told me to sit in the wheelchair and drive myself to the station to buy water. I couldn’t reach and asked one of the nurses to help while literally dying inside from all the pain and she told me to wait and walked away to her other peers and talked about her holiday so I didn’t get the water. Than I asked for some pain killer and they gave me an attitude about how they can’t give anything and have to wait. After 2+ hours of waiting they sent me to x-ray stretching my arms out completely and I screamed of pain as they handled me so rough that even death would feel better at this point. The worst hospital I ever dealt with. Oh and they gave me a bandage rope to hang my hand on as it wobbled and sent me home. Next day I go to HSC and they grabbed their heads and have me a sling as I told them I can’t walk or even move my arm from all the pain. 8 month later and 6 X-rays got told it’s all healed just to come for final X-ray and they asked me why I didn’t get proper treatment that the shoulder is still broken and needed surgery asap. This time had to cut open my hip to take a bone to place in my arm now that’s Canadian healthcare for you!!!!

Discharged December 22, 2023. My stay at Seven Oaks Hospital was great. 👍 The staff treated me as a patient who needed there help. Occupational Therapist Staff are professional in getting me back my strength. I would like thank Gavin who advised me that I needed Therapy.
Michael Sech🏥🩺 …

I was taken to urgent care by my family September 19/2023. The ambulance wasn’t sure how long they’d be. I had slurred speech, chest pain and my left arm was numb. I had such a headache stomach pain I couldn’t stand up. They refused to let my son bring me in in a wheelchair. I was unable to answer questions asked by the charge nurse because of tremors. They refused to let me have a cot and I had to lay on the floor of urgent care with a blanket and pillow I brought from home. My son had to carry me to the toilet as I couldn’t walk on my own. I was literally meaning and wailing for over 6 hours until I was seen. The nurses were not only rude, they were cruel.I was extremely dehydrated and the only thing I was told as I was vomiting was “stop drinking all that water!” The nurses refused to even make eye contact with me as I begged to be given a cott to lay in.I was eventually put on an IV dri. No covid test was administered. It’s almost a week later and I’m still off work and did a self administered COVID TEST. It’s positive. I feel as a recovering addict and Métis person I was stigmatized by hospital staff. It was humiliating and dehumanizing

I am not impressed with the care I've received here at all.

I visited 7 Oaks Hospital twice for Urgent Care following my car injury, once for my elbow and again for my concussion. During both times, the triage nurses were very rude. The first time, I was treated fairly quickly but the doctor was only in the room for 2 minutes to talk to me. He prescribed me pain medication and quickly sent me on my way. The nurse treated my wound and sent me off with some bandages but did not teach me how or how often I should change it.

I came back the next day because my head was pounding. I actually went to a walk-in clinic first and the doctor there told me to go back to 7 Oaks for some scans due to my concussion. I went back and instantly regretted my decision. I waited about 4.5hr to be told I only had a "neck sprain" and the doctor talked to me in a very condescending way, like I was a child. He only offered me 1-2 days off for a note when my head/neck was immovable. No note for physio or chiro either even though it's covered by insurance. Even with pain medication, I still have really bad migraines. Despite that, the nurse that assessed me was very kind and nice.

I just want to say that I am very disappointed with my experience here and unfortunately won't be coming back. I feel as if it's more worth my time if I drive further for better care at another hospital.

Do they even know what Urgent care means??? If i could Rate 0 based on my experience today with this Hospital. I would. Being a Urgent care facillity I waited here for 4 hours just to get some immediate Medical attention with Face bleeding. I waited paitently and asked again after 4 hours how much time it will take and the staff was like we don't know. We can't give any time there's seniors waiting before you. What's wrong with Medical here. Like seriously. They are letting people die infront of them and call themselves an urgent care..What a Joke!!!! I saw a couple there they despartely needed help with something and the girl was not feeling well and puking alot and they made her wait for so much time and she was literally crying about that and they didn't care. Cmon guys its every canadian's right to get good medical attention which you guys are definitely not providing

While waiting to see a doctor. I got severe cold chills. I asked the volunteer for a blanket. He said," I will ask a nurse, the nurse said "NO". I was very upset, stood up and got loud. The volunteer left and came back with the heated blanket. That nurse is lucky I did not get face to face with her. It is no wonder people call this hospital SEVEN JOKES HOSPITAL

Horrible experience for urgent care. Went there for my husband's abdominal pain and has been suffering for 2 weeks now. We waited for over 7 hours (04:28-11:53) getting pushed down the priority list and had to leave without getting the care he needs. It seems like they didnt take it as serious pain even when he rated it 9.5 out of 10 (He is in so much when we got there). We waited patiently, trying his best even though he is hurting so much and as hours passed by, it toned down.

They took blood pressure test around 10:30 pm and was told that there's one more person before him to be called and they are also waiting for a bed. Waited again for more than an hour, 11:50pm (the pain's gone by then) and was told to wait again and they will get another blood pressure check. Feeling very frustrated, he left without getting checked because he drained his energy with the pain and with the long wait.
Other people were called before him and they can even walk properly and does not seem to be needing 'urgent' care. It was so frustrating.

It was my first time visiting this amazing place in Winnipeg. It's quite massive and boasts of friendly staff. Also the whole place was very neat.

The directions to different units of the hospital is quite clear, and of course you can always ask questions.

The wait wasn't long and the experience was generally great. But I wasn't prepared for paid parking, the first I've seen in a hospital.

I was treated with respect, and was in and being seen by a doctor withing half an hour. Everyone was kind, and I was checked on and had tests right away. They made sure I had a way to get home. Place is clean and covid compliant. Thanks much!

One of the worst urgent care of all time! I was there for 3 hrs and when I asked the nurse how long it might take she was rude and said “ I don’t know 6,7 hrs. Give me a break!” I left untreated becouse in the whole 3 hrs I was there not a single patient that was there before me got to see the doctor so obviously I wasn’t gettting any care anytime soon either.
Botched my sugery and didn't even tell me 😁 don't even think it was a doctor who did it and when I asked him for an anesthetic he got mad at me …

Honestly, don’t even go unless you really really have to like your toe is falling off or something because the wait times are way longer than what they tell you. I had a dog bite and wait time ended up being 12 hours from 5 in the urgent care. Urgent care is not really urgent to them. I spent the night there and the doctor saw me at 11 the next morning. My situation was still manageable but there were people , especially really old people who would need someone to look after them and it was so painful to just see them helplessly sitting there. Because of the long wait times, patient’s situation gets way way worse. The doctor I saw was amazing but the one on night duty didn’t do anything. Horrible.

This hospital has staff who don't care and they don't hesitate to show that. I went in for my extreme period cramps and they did not acknowledge anything besides the fact that I had anxiety ( is a person defined by what they have) like I just nauseated with blood and they don't care instead they tell me there is nothing they can do. The front desk staff ask my father if I can speak English like yes I can but the thing is I am trying not to speak so I do not vommit creating more work for all of you. She goes " oh yes it's always this busy blah blah to my father" like okay and you chose this job I did not so can you do it without complaining and being unprofessional. I understand how frustrating it can be being a health care worker but to just  have an attitude while dealing with patients is unacceptable. I left the facility with zero help and disappointment. I was not only judged by the fact I was anxious but judged if I can speak a language. Than if you bring such things up they say they are not judging you. Previously I have gotten blood work done there and the worker was extremely rude she says "I don't have all day". I was sitting in a psych office like do you have any sympathy at all. It is extremely disturbing and disappointing how they treat people. I feel awful for the people that have to go through this or even worse here.

Was a day surgery patient at Seven Oaks Hospital. It was a great experience right from the time my husband and I stepped through the door and was looking at the information map and an elderly gentleman politely asked if he could help us find our way. He gave us directions to the day surgery clerk who was also very polite. We were then directed to a waiting room where we sat for no longer than 10 minutes before a nurse asked me to follow her to the day surgery area. After putting on my surgery gown I was asked to get comfy in a reclining chair with a heated blanket. The nurse who then looked after me was so wonderful! Full of energy, kind words and humour! During my wait for surgery my heated blanket was replaced two more times! The professionals in the surgery room were great! Dr Hubert was the surgeon and he explained the whole procedure as he performed his tasks and I watched on a monitor.
The recovery room nurses were very nice and back at day surgery room after was again a great experience.
Thank you all for making a possibly stressful day into a wonderful experience!
Kind regards
Pam Schmidt

I had a horrible urgent care experience. I told them I was feeling dizzy and had a blurred vision but they didn't take me seriously and decided to make me wait hours beyond the estimated wait time. I left without getting the care I need cause I felt nauseous and sick. They didn't allow me to let my emergency person in with me so I had to stay till late at night sick and dizzy trying to find a way for me to get home. Urgent care is NOT what this place provide to people but they further compromise people's wellbeing.

0 stars if I could. All my experiences at the triage have been completely terrible. They're inconsiderate and ignorant. There are signs that say to update them on symptoms and if you're feeling worse but they don't care about what you're feeling they only care about what they can see. I would rather die than go back to this hospital due to some of the staff. I will say though that the people doing my bloodwork and ekg were nicer and easier to work with. The people that don't like their jobs should leave instead of making the patients miserable.

So bad… don’t waste your time here.
First visit, they didn’t do sufficient testing, missed a deadly stomach infection and sent me home, that resulted in hospitalization when i went to HSC to get a second opinion.

Second visit, the staff are ignorant. Waited 6+ hours to be put in a second waiting room to wait longer. For a simple X-ray result… ended up leaving, unsatisfied and still in pain.

Aside from that, the Security was very helpful.
X-ray Tech was very friendly and kind.

Conclusion: Don’t go here if you want to be treated poorly and not get answers for your wellbeing.

I recently had a terrible experience at Seven Oaks Hospital in Winnipeg, Manitoba. The mistreatment I received was maliciously and unacceptable it left me feeling traumatized. The staff was dismissive, racist and uncaring, showing little empathy for my situation. The lack of attention to detail and disregard for basic patient needs was astounding. It felt like I was just another First Nations number in their system.

The facilities were also subpar, and the equipment appeared outdated and poorly maintained. I was appalled by the lack of cleanliness in the hospital, which made me question the overall hygiene standards.

I hope that the hospital administration will take my concerns seriously and take immediate action to address the discrimination issues I faced. Patients deserve to be treated with respect and dignity, and I hope that future visitors to Seven Oaks Hospital will not have to go through what I did.

I’m very disappointed in the lack of care at this hospital for my aging father. The staff was incompetent- lacked effective communication & took forever to provide a safe care plan upon discharge then charged my father for his extended stay! - to witness how awful this hospital’s treatment of the elderly was so disappointing- (patient relations was not supportive or helpful in anyway )

Great example of how an Urgent Care Clinic should be. Urgent Care at The Seven Oaks was awesome!  Within the first 45 minutes of being there I had seen a doctor, got blood tests and X-ray done and medication.  Nurses came to check your vital signs on a regular basis.  Was there a total of 3 hours, plus I saw a different Doctor before I was released!  Staff was friendly and cheerful and cared for your wellbeing!   Hopefully, I never have to go there again but they will be 1st on my list if I do.

Worst hospital ever for urgent care. They ask you to wait for 7 hrs just to find out what type of vaginal infection do you have. I rather take OTC medication instead coming here. I waited whole day  & left untreated.
Staff & Dr does not seem to care at all.

1 star is too much.

My 83 year old, disabled mother with a walker and fighting double lung cancer was admitted yesterday after 11pm. I called all over the city trying to find where the ambulance took her. Not only did the ambulance take over 2 hours to pick her up, it took till the following morning to track her down. Seven oaks told me they discharged her at 4:30 am, alone. And they didn't call anyone.

She fell twice and banged her head..yet nothing was done or even tested.

I called to inquire and the staff knew nothing. Didn't know if she was alone or not. Didn't know if she was safe to go home alone. They didn't contact no one. Plus the lady had a bit of attitude..saying well..did you try her house? Like really..you're going to give me attitude when you lost my senior mom?

If something happened to her from the hospital to home....who would be responsible?

I bet no one will take responsibility for this...so I'll just share this story until we are heard!

Terrible Seven Oaks.  You should be ashamed and embarrassed.

Booooo on you!

Wait time eta was 2.5 hours, I was there for 10 hours. The ladies at the front desk in urgent care were very insensitive. Thankfully my nurse and doctor were amazing! So 3 stars due to the unsympathetic ladies that rolled their eyes at me. Wish I got their names so I can file a complaint.

Urgent care sucks….been waiting here for 6 hours….I asked 2 different nurses. No one is giving me any particular time frame.
I asked politely how much more time for my wife to be seen. Got the reply- docter will see people when they see people.

Had been there for 7 hours last night with my 9 year old son had problem in his urine coming blood. At the end the Doctor end up saying that we don't have machines to check kids.
So why don't their registering guy told us before to go children's hospital urgent care. Completely unprofessional. Please put 0 star in your system also because you don't deserve a single  star.
Completely disaster.

I had an amazing experience here today. I came around 10:30-10:45am and the lady at the front desk was extremely helpful and kind. She helped me get X-rays and checked by a doctor very quickly! I didn’t quite catch her name but she made going to urgent care less stressful and super efficient. I was out of there treated within an hour. This lady deserves a raise she was absolutely fantastic, I wish I would’ve caught her name!

Came here because I couldn't catch my breath, felt very weak. Asked the lady how long of a wait b4 I checked in. Told me 5 hours. 13.5 hours in and still waiting to get into a room.
There is a reason they call it 7jokes. This place is garbage.
If I would have known it was going to b this long I would have gone somewhere else.
Was also told I'm not allowed a person with me. While I'm sitting there 6 others have a person with them. Asked security why that is.i was told it depends on the person that is standing at the door if they will allow a person with u

Rude, passive aggressive, and condescending staff at urgent care. Just under 20 weeks pregnant and came here during the weekend because of sharp pains and difficulty moving during the pain. The triage staff talk over you and mumble their questions. The nurse who did my blood work was very condescending. She was rude throughout, and told me I had to put pressure after. I wanted to leave quickly. She called after me, “or not, you can bleed if you want to.” Don’t recommend. Go to st boniface if you can.

I came to Urgent Care with a referral from my family doctor who is out of province, I explained the symptoms briefly to the intake nurse at the desk and was given a blood test quickly, after that was made to wait 10 hours.

While the dim lighting was calming and there was plenty of seating, there was insufficient security for the number of people entering and inebriated or otherwise approaching other patients in the waiting room inappropriately.

After my 10 hour wait, I was given about 2 minutes with a specialist nurse who was kind, and then only about 1 minute with a doctor who didn't take the time to go over my options for treatment or prescribe anything even though I had mentioned I was out of province. The doctor in question then mentioned he'd schedule a follow up but never did so, I had to confirm that myself by calling Urgent Care the following day.

I was very disappointed.

This is the same hospital where my mother was taken when she had a seizure from a brain tumor and a simultaneous shoulder dislocation. The first ER doctor to see her saw the tumor but not the shoulder, leaving her in agony for over 12 hours until a shift change when the 2nd doctor arrived and popped it back in.

The wait times here are the lowest because the staff rush people out the door.

Went in sat for 8 hours before finding out I was taken off the urgent care list. Dr tried to get me to do treatments I am allergic to. I was lied to about lab results. Was told I would have an emergency ultrasound the next day, ultrasound was closed for the next 3 days and when they finally called me back they had no idea who I was. When I made a formal complaint I was told all was done according to policy and within guidelines.  GO HERE ONLY IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A PLACE TO DIE

I was at the urgent care as i had pain in my chest. They just did ECG and did the blood test. Afterthat i waited for 4-5 hours but no doctor and no nurse examined me. When i asked that what is estimated time then they said that they donot have any estimated time. They said that there are paitents who was waiting for more than 7 hours. The medical system in canada is not good. I left the place as no one doing anything. I was very disappointec with all this

Update: Had a fantastic call with Shannon from patient services.  She really listened and understood my concerns.  Even talked how this experience can go forward to help understand invisible disabilities in people coming to Seven Oaks.  Shannon bumped the one star up to 3 with her excellent service.

Went to Urgent care. Made sure to go when there was a short wait time due to the fact I'm autistic. The whole time I was there only one person actually got in to see a Dr. The waiting room filled up and I started to get anxious.  Went to the desk to see if I could sit somewhere else.  Explained to the clerk why and got totally blown off. Clerk barely raised her head from texting on her phone. Unprofessional and disrespecting of a person with a disability.

Very inconsistent answers from each health care professional  which led to a very negative experience. Very rude staff at least the day I was there with the exception of 1 nurse. I even watched them leave a woman in the EKG room for an hour and admitted to forgetting she was in there.

Sunday, September 4, 2022 7:07am

I rushed my wife this morning. She was throwing up the entire night and started to feel an unbearable cramping pain by 6am. We suspect food poisoning since it started when she prepared herself some Japanese instant noodles around
9:00pm last night.

She can't barely walk nor speak but the very unmindful Triage staff kept giving instructions and asking questions, even forcing her to speak more clearly or repeat her answers. I was hoping to facilitate for her since obviously, she already is in so much pain but she kept condescending me.

I believe the doctors are good but the staff, I was appalled by their seemingly lack of tact and zero sense of urgency for an Urgent Care facility.

Worse, probably she wants me to feel her superiority,  asked me to wheel my wife in an adjacent area but instructed me to wait in my car???...like, seriously, my wife is in so much pain and is almost at the brink of passing out..

The explanation given to me was more
appalling..that she has to be left by herself because she's been vomiting...for crying out loud! That doesn't make any sense!!!

I had such a great experience here last night! I waited about 7hours which is expected. I was there from 6pm and got into emergency just last midnight. The doctor and the nurse who helped me were really wonderful and caring. They went out of their way to help me and make me feel comfortable.

The nurses at the front are very unprofessional. They are sending people randomly inside. Don’t care about anybody. If you will go to ask anything then they will just ignore you. They are so rude and always give responses sarcastically. I would suggest not to visit this hospital. Moreover, these nurses are always busy in using their cellphones.

Best care anyone could ask for. After being admitted for the second time I am left with feeling grateful and full of appreciation. Bravo and many thanks to the Emergency, Shannon my coffee buddy and Lisa who took such great care of me.Also the 3rd floor Unit 11 nurses, Jennifer, John, Leno, and so many more. I know I was independent, but you made it easy. Spent another day in Urgent care for chest pains 26/10/2020. Bumped into my coffee nurse and was excited to see Shannon again. An angel of mercy and good cheer. Still love all that they do during this pandemic. God bless them all.

The wait times are unacceptable and the lady at the entrance was unwelcoming. Triage nurses weren't very knowledgeable. The initial front facing staff give off a bad first impression.

Having said that the nurse who took my bloodwork was very kind and friendly. Once finally admitted to a room, the attending nurse and doctor were also both friendly and as helpful as they could be.

It would have been even more helpful though if the triage nurses mentioned that there were no gynecologists on site. I waited four hours to be told to go to HSC next time. Why could this not be triaged at the front desk??
Urgent Care was clean and efficient. Everyone I dealt with was kind and patient. Dr. Darren was one of the best doctors I have ever dealt with! They made a not so great time comforting and positive.

Hi… today I was having my ultrasound and it went very well. My sonographer dealt me very well. she was very cheerful and friendly.There was no waiting time. My appointment was at 1 and I was in for my examination at sharp 1. Nice experience.Thanks

Brought a TV in for a long-term patient. She checked with the nurse before I drove into the city and was told it was fine...just have to be checked by maintenance...no problem. Drove in, got through screening, up to the unit only to be told that Dave, the weekend manager, changed his mind! Thanks Dave!  Hope you waste an hour and gas  to be turned away! It's obvious that communication has NOT improved here in the past 2 years.  Not shocking at all...this helps to perpetuate the long-standing nickname you have.  How disappointing 😞

If you like waiting for 14h just to leave untreated, this is the place for you. Crazy large lot of land being used as a cash grab apparently. Certainly not doing anything with the patients. Saw 30 people in the waiting room, sign saying average wait 4h. I'm in immense pain and they couldn't even be bothered to ask where or why. Great job converting to Urgent Care, Pallister. Waste of time, money, and ambulance resources. Yeah, brought in by ambulance, just to be ignored...

I wish I could do No stars. Such a rude staff they have. No humanity at all. Go to HSC instead rather than going here. The nurse call Jaidie/jaidey, rudest , cruel nurse I have ever met. She works in urgent care during night time, just ignore her arrogance and speak to someone else .

Just came in today to this hospital. I had bad sore throat possibly tonsils. I came for doctor to check up as I was in pain. I had cough accumulating at the same time. They mentioned the wait times was crazy like minimum 3 hours and it can last longer. I was having issues seating with pain. I asked if they had warm water Atleast I can sip and that would have given some relief. The girl at the front said they don’t have warm water. I asked, if they have Atleast water she said not really but on the other side we can go purchase the water if we like. I asked her if the wait times is higher, and they don’t give warm water. I can go out and have something warm. She told me if I go, my name will be removed and once I’m back , wait time will start from there.

What kind of services we are in ???? No free water at the hospital ? If wait times are crazy Atleast this was very little thing to ask while seating with pain.

This place has had a bad reputation from the day it was built, horrible.
The staff is extremely rude and unprofessional.
The night my mother died I went to tell the nursing staff in that area that I thought she had stopped breathing, and the person I spoke to said in the rudest way possible "you're at the wrong desk"
Absolutely zero professionalism or empathy or any kind of caring.
They then let me drive home by myself nobody talked to me stopped me or even asked if I was okay they simply let me leave.
7 Oaks, more like 7 jokes.

This is a joke. It shows on the website the waiting time is 5 hours. We have been here for 18 hours without being treated. Yet they are fast enough to issue the invoice to my mom who is a traveller. No treatment has been provided. Ridiculous! Still waiting. 6 hours ago they told us we would be the next. Go somewhere else!!

I have never experience this in any other hospital some of the stuff are rud and resist. I went to the urgent care I was waiting almost 9 hour i was pregnant and have covid. After wating this long hours i ask them i am getting sick and tirde one of the stuff member told me if you want to leave you can  go other wise i have to Wait another 1hour.

Totally weird services just came to emergency because of my blood pressure pills was over so I asked for refilled or just give me one tonight next day I’ll see my family doctor but they said you have to wait for 6 hour for blood pressure medicine and see the doctor first. They don’t care if blood pressure patient got a stroke

When for what I thought was a bad ankel sprain,  did have to wait to long to do first assessment.  The was taken for x-rays, did wait a while for a second opinion which led to technical difficulties with the computer, so waited another 2 hrs to be told I need a CT scan. All to determine a break. All in all the staff were good and friendly and took their time.

Still systematic racism being faced by indigenous patients seeking care. My brother went to receive care for a bursting appendix, in incredible pain. Had to wait 6 hours to see a doctor with no pain management support, despite exclaiming he was in the worst pain of his life. Then he had to wait another 2 hours after seeing the doctor and had to scream to receive any pain meds. Was accused by the night nurse that he was timing his meds and abusing it.... Completely unacceptable and unwarranted. The night nurse on Feb - 3 Feb 4 on the Urgent Care MTA area needs to be reprimanded as her racist stereotypes are completely unacceptable. She had the nerve to tell him in the peak of his pain that "The pain won't kill you but the meds will". Is this the level of care indigenous people can expect here? I would have hoped after Joyce Echaquan that Canadian health care staff would work on providing adequate care to indigenous patients, I guess not at Seven Oaks. If you're indigenous, don't seek care here.

Waited in the ER for 5.5 hours. Moved to a discharge room. Told to sit in there. It's been one hour still waiting  The drs and nurses were laughing that there was only 12 patients left in the waiting room. They must have all left.

The waiting time went from 4 hours to 5 plus hours after they told patients we wont be able to see you today. One lady  had been waiting for 6.5 hours and told to go home.

Dr just came in going to send me for a chest xray.

Oh he did apologize for the wait time.

My brother was treated really bad! He was taken in for a bad head injury and when I showed up he was slumped over on a chair in the waiting room! Took me 5 mins to wake him up! If you wanna die just come here

No stars: Worst hospital ever there are people waiting in the waiting room for longer than 24 hrs I came in with hyperstensive heart problems and was made wait all day till I left without help because I am to tired to sit in a chair for over 8 hours, by far the Worst hospital in Winnipeg for waiting times.
I'd have to say the HSC works faster even when crowded, faster then seven oaks ever will be able to work.

This hospital has the worst patient care ever! I took my aunty to Urgent care but we had to leave after 4 hours of waiting to see a doctor. There were moody nurses who did not care much. There were two patients crying in pain and they were told to keep the noise down as there was nothing they could do for them. Urgent Care does not deserve even one star.

Not writing a review. Just saddened that every negative review here is given an email address to write to. No apology given by the Seven Oaks Hospital management and sadly no one takes ownership for anything they did wrong. On the other hand, 5 star reviews get a "happy to hear your positive experience" as a response. Interesting.

I read lots of negative reviews of Seven Oaks, but I have to say, I went, expecting my visit to last 4 hours so I knew what to expect. All the staff were super nice. I was greeted at the door by a volunteer, seen by a great Dr, xrayed, and out the door in about 4 hours. It was great.

Extremely unpleasant stay, staff seems to be more focused on socializing with each other than with patients. During my brief 2 day visit I was met with some fairly rude nurses and doctors. However I was more concerned about how they treat the elderly, this poor man who clearly has some form of dementia has been practically ignored while he screams and cries for help, at night they simply just closed the door to his room. The nurses here require more training for patients who have dementia, that treatment is appalling.

Even if someone's dying you will be told to wait, wait times are really long saw a patient coming out of room, but no one got called in till now its been 20 minutes already since last patient got out. My throat is about to split open from coughing and they wont take no one in. Good wastage of citys resources.

Horrible hospital that's why they call it seven jokes general hospital. Currently sitting in urgent care, a patient asked how far in line is he and they told him 16th he said I will just come back in an ambulance (couldnt breathe) and the staff laughed in his face and told him he will still have to wait . Just like all the other Google reviews this hospital is a rude environment and ignorant staff.

A little personal, I was in a bad place, depressed out of my mind and I took a lot of pills to try and overdose. I was brought to the hospital by my friend and I was unconscious the whole time but she said we were waiting in the waiting area for over 6 hours and she kept going up to the desk to say I was overdocing and completly unconscious with shallow breathing every half hour to hour and they still never did anything. Finally in a room it took another 3 hours to see a doctor. If the pills I took were any stronger I would have died in the waiting room! Finally we couldn't leave until they gave me a self care package and told me about resources in the city. We had to wait another 3 hours for that! Pretty sure they just forgot about us. Horrible experience and will never go back no matter what!

I came to this hospital with an injured eye. The nurse was very friendly and helped me, translating what I did not understand in the translator, because my English is very bad. I am also grateful to Dr. Aiman ​​and Lim, they are …

I was in the ER. for severe abdominal pain, vomitting and diarrhea. I was taken to Seven Oaks by ambulance. I was in excruciating pain, was triaged and told there was no emergency bed available and put into the waiting room with other waiting patients for 5 hrs without being seen by a physician or getting anything for pain. I begged the staff to help me, they were short tempered and told me to stop making so much noise as I was upsetting other patients. When I was transferred to the back to be seen by a physician I was informed that my blood count was normal and was given med. for nausea and colic, but still no analgesia. The Dr. informed me I had the flu and not a particularly bad one as I was not dehydrated yet. A short period of time later the same physician returned and stated that my chemistry showed and increase in my liver enzymes and at that time finally gave me analgesia. I had an ultra sound of gallbladder in am and the young Dr. in am stated there was no need for further intervention. I was discharged.
The following day I visited my family physician with recurrence of pain. Fortunately that evening was admitted to St Boniface Hospital surgical observation, treated with appropriate meds and had my gall bladder removed the next day. My stay  and care there was excellent .

I would like it noted that I have been a Registered Nurse for 35 years in Manitoba and I too have dealt with staff cut backs,but have never treated another human being the way I was treated at Seven Oaks Hospital.
Can the name of the doctor who took the wrong leg be announced?
I went for Chest CT scan well before time. The staff at the front desk as well as in CT Scan deptt was very polite n helping. No wait time. As international visitor, my experience is excellent.

Only reason one star is given is because the ER is decent except the manager who "allowed" my elderly Mum 5 minutes to decide to ship him off to Concordia by Ambulance which had no history of my dad's condition and was too far away. She cannot drive nor can take a bus and this hospital is closest to her home. The manager got snippy and told her how much time the doctors wasted on him. Lol like quel dommage isn't that their job to actually care for their patient and not an obligation??
Unfortunately my dad had his medical history here so we decided that he would once again stay.
Doctors are never there to discuss family member's concerns. Rude, unapproachable "professionals" who run this hospital. Patient "consultant" primary bias is with the hospital,  ignoring errors with a move forward crapola attitude.  Moreover, had the audacity to tell my Mum to refrain from being rude when they're the rude ones. Feel bad for the nursing staff who has to get asked questions from all patient's family members because the doctors are never around at all.
If you have elderly relatives please send them elsewhere!!!

My experience with the hospital was great just because of the screener. I would like to give 5 stars to the screener. Moreover, they are so polite and very helpful if you don't know anything about parking or some other things too.
I don't know what they gonna after the screener leave but they are all amazing staff.

Huge shoutout to the doctor, nurses and staff at Seven Oaks Urgent Care. They took fantastic care of my SO today. He needed a roster of tests and meds after an esophageal stent placement a few days ago, and they were warm, caring and thoroughly professional. He came out looking and feeling worlds better today, and had his first comfortable evening in a while. He even kept down some real food :) We are so grateful to you all!

Rude receptionist and entrance staff ! Still waiting after 5 hours to see what it will go cos we didn’t want to waste these 5 hours of wait but so far the experience was terrible ! I advise that you wait until something life threatening and go to the ER instead !!

My mother passed away here. Each time I needed paperwork signed by the doctor, it would take almost a month just to get it. Otherwise, while my mom was at the General Hospital, they treated her well. However, she had told me that they were very rough with her on the Emergency side. Even when she told them. They still continued to be rough with her.

If I could leave a - 10 I would. We have taken my mother to this hole of a hospital 3 times this week due to needing a catheter, blocked colon and mental issues and each time they would not admit her.  Wednesday had to take her crisis Centre wouldn't do anything for us. Last night called the ambulance at 1am and it showed up at 5am!!! Terrible revolving door that can't even recognize a crisis....and won't help a woman in desperate need of medical care  They should all be very ashamed

Came in by ambulance and ended
Up in the hallway for over an hour and then asked to waiting in waiting room for the next 6 hours and the barely any tests done before being sent home. My own family doctor did better than a hospital combined.  They shrug off your pain as if it’s nothing.  I don’t know about the upper floors but triage and emergency staff need an overall personality makeover

6 hours to see , not a doctor , but a nurse practitioner.
Hyper extension on my knee and I could not walk on it or bend it at all . I should also mention it hurt more than anything I'd ever done ever before and at 60 I've been hurt more than a few times.
So what did I receive from them ,
X-ray to confirm , no broken bones.
An offer of 2 Asa and a set of crutches ( rented of course)
No paperwork
No referral to a doctor
Nothing
People have called this place " seven jokes"   I Agree now !
i'm adding to this after months , because what they deemed to be basically nothing then , turned out to be a badly torn miniscaus ( the cushioning inside the knee ) I a now in line for surgery .
Way to go seven jokes ,

I have been dealing with digestive issues for years...I am currently on a wait list to be seen by a specialist however was experiencing some invasive symptoms. I have 2 young children and this not only affects my home life but my ability to work.. I came in to this hospital concerned about a new , unfirmiliar symptom and was appalled at the care I recieved. While in the wait room I explained that I was having a burning discomfort in my stomach, not pain, discomfort . I told her this to inform the doctor to update my symptoms. She then told me that I was not allowed pain medication which although I hadn't requested any, she didn't bother explaining why I was unable to take anything and told me to sit back down. After being called in, I assumed they would want to examine the area I was experiencing trouble with but instead they relied souly on my blood work and didn't even examine me. He then told me I am starving myself and he thinks I have an eating disorder, although I've been trying to gain weight... regardless of how much I insisted I was in pain and something felt wrong all he said was "eat something" and told me he thought it was an eating disorder and it was psychological, and he doesn't believe I have a gut issue. He had no desire to answer any questions and seemed annoyed when I asked him any questions.. was completely disregarded and made to feel like a con artist ... I will never return to this place , what awful patient care. Avoid this hospital

I would give this hospital a negative zero if I could
My mother broke her arm the other day and was taken to Selkirk for a cast but it harderned wrong so it was too painful to sleep so I take her to seven oaks, which I regret because as soon as we were called to the desk they asked what her medications were and the last time they were taken, standard procedure seemingly. We were finally called to a room and when the doctor came in he made no contact and then accused my mother of coming in to ask for narcotics when we simply just came for a new cast, not medication. We tried explaining to the doctor she only needed a new cast but he just told us to stop talking so he could continue accusing my mother. After the doctor left the nurse came in and was just as rude. She did very little to help. Overall this is a horrid experience and would not reccomend... EVER!!!

i was injured in a vehicle yesterday. i am dizzy today and cannot move my neck. i need to be assessed by a doctor for concussion. it is new years eve day today and the last time i was in this hospital i was in there for a broken foot. i had fallen down due to a sudden stress facture in my foot. i did not know it was broken at first. i went to this urgent care where i was made to wear a bright orange wrist band saying AT RISK FOR FALLS and them made to walk everywhere on my broken foot. when the doctor came in after x rays he told me that my foot was not broken and would welfare pay for tylenol? i am a nurse. i am not on welfare. i left walking on a broken foot and no health care. i went to my own doctor the next day and he told me i had broken my foot. and he gave me painkillers. seven oakes IS a joke. i complained to the whra, who called me and gave me a number to call at seven jokes. i called the number where a woman told me i was liar and it never happened and then hung up on me. i am not sure where i will go for this concussion when all the walk in clinics are closed for this head injury but i think going to seven jokes would just be a waste of time and energy. too bad. i really need a doctor right now.

My 87 year old mother, broke her leg in Feb. 2017.  Before this happened she had a complicated health history. Her care for the broken leg was good, however we had concerns about her returning home. My mom also had physical complaints about other health issues.
Seven Oaks took time to address everyone of our concerns and all of my mom's physical complaints. They let us talk to each of the specialists involved, and provided a treatment plan. This also included  getting the right balance of medications and home care in place.
The work Seven Oaks has done has changed our family's life. The difference in my mom is amazing, she is engaged and active. We are no longer running to doctor's appointments or spending time in emergency.
Thank you Dr. Abbott and the  Gerriatic Rehab Team.
Laura Austin

Really this hospital doesn’t deserve any star. I went there as i was suffered from UTI. I waited  over there for 2 hours and they took me inside and when the doctor came to see me can u imagine how he treats me. He came and remained stand by the door. Just tell his name and didn’t even ask how long been I suffered from this problem what is current status of problem, nothing. He just gave prescriptions and was about to go, at that time I said excuse me doctor, how many days it will take to cure? He said just only two words, that is  3:days and left. This is like that they are playing doctor- doctor game. Isn’t it. I still remembered that doctor’s name. Not happy.

Last 3 times we went there for ER and we experienced terrible care. Waste of time and a drive. They sent us a survey and I honestly just threw it away. If they dont know they suck, thats a total joke. No wonder its called Seven Jokes. Staff is not compassionate and you can see doctors standing around chatting for hours before they tend to your emergency. Literally just standing around on their phones talking utter b.s. anywhere else is a better option than this place. Grade F

Seven Jokes Hospital. Waited in a room for 7 hours for a doctor to come see me. After 3 hours went to go look at the waiting room. Empty. Walked by all the little curtained booths in the area. I counted 3 other people. 2 were sleeping. Waited an additional 4 hours anyway. This is what happens when government runs your health care system. If the money was going directly from our pockets to the doctors’ pockets they would fall over each other to get your business.

This hospital does not deserve any stars. Always the worst treatment whenever I was forced to go there. Lived in the area too. How bad is that???? Had my nerve endings in my hand sewed to muscle tissue!! Talk about the pain!! They just shrugged it off like it was nothing while I was in pain from the 4 inch cut. Thanks for nothing!!

If you value your life please don't go here.
Miscommunication,confusion,lack of urgency,lack of compassion,poorly trained.......and on it goes.
I have lost two family members in this hospital.The experience has been nothing short of a nightmare. There are a few nurses who are shining stars in this hospital but unfortunately there are too many who just don't give a damn about patients or relatives. Not calling family while a patient is in the final hours of life is unforgiveable. Giving a patient a drug to render them completely comatose until death without consulting family first is another unforgiveable.
Then you have some old doctors who are worse than nurses making the rounds and putting in time till retirement. They evade patients families whenever possible and rarely show up on time for a meeting if at all.
They misdiagnose conditions or prescribe wrong meds. If your family member is senior they basically just write them off. So many patients are overmedicated until they die but it makes for easy care by the nurses and doctors. People don't believe how bad this hospital is until they experience it first hand.

Ive literally been sitting in the waiting room for 9 hours, with a fractured tibia or fibia bone and i need an xray. Im furious how long i have to wait for an xray, will be forwarding my complaints and concerns to WRHA, this is terrible service.

My mother had a stroke and the doctor did not administer the shot to bust the blood clot in her head. He said that it would damage her if it wasn't needed. She was already paralyzed on one side ,wouldnt that tell a good doctor that chances are she'd need that shot?
Well it was needed she suffered a 2 nd stroke and passed away 2 days later.

I believe it was because of her age, she was only 78.
They don't want to save older people which is very sad as these people still have loved ones that need them.
I'll bet that doctor would do anything to save his mother but cared very little for ours.
I believe in karma, I hope he gets his.

Worst patient care ever. Period. The staff were busy chatting and checking their phones instead of caring for patients, they rolled their eyes and acted as if any interruption by the patients was a huge inconvenience to them, and the wait times are ridiculous. If you can avoid it, NEVER come to this emergency care centre.

Have very swollen tonsils to the point of cryin , can’t swallow pills or fluids , waited from 4:48 -6:00 am to see the doctor he was super nice , but in the mean time I had asked for pain meds. Explain I couldn’t swallow anything and I got nothing ,  then after the doctor left he said I would get something for pain , and they would take blood 15 minuets later got my blood taken and then 45 mins later still waiting for pain meds , went and asked and the nurse told me there is nothing she can do for me because I cannot swallow anything , I work in the health care system there are other things you can do , but the nurses rather stand around the desk and talk instead of actually help people, if I wanted to sit and deal with this I would of stayed at home I came here to get help , and I got nothing . Doctor finally came back and is giving me an IV hooray!!!

This hospital should be shut down for not careing about patiences health at all. A friend went by ambulance 5 times to emergency with chest pains and they ended up sending him home every time. Today he was taken there again and like before these so called Doctors and nurses sent him home well as they left this man starts getting dizzy and sick so they that is his daughter has just taken him to StBonifice close enough all these staff should be forced to go threw training again for they care for no one.

Don't ever go to Seven Jokes hospital. Nurses are so rude and they don't care until you die. Too long for waiting time atleast 6 hours!!! If you care about your life or your love one's avoid these hospital.

It's quite unfortunate to have to be in a place like a hospital. It is a place filled with fear and questions. A simple requirement to being employed in a place that deals with such intense fears should be COMPASSION!! Something I thought, until tonight was the reason people dedicate their lives to patient care. My view on human nature changed in the matter of minutes. A nurse on the fourth floor (I will be filing an official complaint against her) was the most unprofessional, lazy and unconcerned nurse in the profession. It was just numerous sighs and eye rolls anytime a question was asked. My precious grandmother has trouble communicating in English and this woman was clearly not of Canadian born parents so if anyone should understand the struggles of immigrants, it should have been her! She was not helpful at all and she was just a snotty, child-like nurse getting paid OUR tax dollars to make peoples lives even more difficult than it already is considering they already have loved ones in a hospital bed

Worst hospital took my 10 year old in as he was having lots of pain in his leg and his toe was really red and very sore. We got in to see a Dr really fast and he looked at my son's leg and foot and all he said  was keep doing what ur doing and keep poping him with pills and follow up with his dr and he said I don't need to do any test as it will be a waste. He never even said what was wrong with him or anything. Who says that to a 10 year old kid. Never going back ever again!
They are  good  help me  out I need to most.

My daughter came to this hospital at the beginning of this month for pains she was having in her stomach, chest and back where i had to call the ambulance, cause she was having a hard time breathing too, my daughter wanted me to go in the back with her the guy said no im just gonna take her herself, so I waited in the waiting area then he came to get me cause she asked for me and explained that all her blood work came back normal, nothing is wrong with her, i asked if he can do an ultra sound on her, he said they did everything they could and everything is fine, amd also said 80 % of people come in on a daily basis, so its normal to be having those kind of pains, so they gave her cookies to eat see if she can hold it down, cause at home she puked after she ate, and sent her home, the next morning she was having the same pains, which i took her to hsc, they did everything blood work and they gave her the ultra sound to make sure they had it right and yes my daughter needed to get surgery done and get her gallstones removed so thanks for leaving my daughter in pain, I hope no one else gets sent home for pains and they check people properly

Came here with my mom and while the wait wasn’t that long, they literally said “there’s nothing we can do for you.” Came back a couple days later because now I was sick, and the nurses at the desk for the ER were very rude and cranky for some odd reason. The way they were talking and the tone of their voice and the looks they were giving were not polite at all.

Worst service, they do not care about the patients they spend the time on their phone. If you ask for something, they say they have no idea. We wait there for more than 10 hours and they always say the same thing to us that they have no idea just wait and wait.
I went to seven oaks hospital with my sister and the staff and nurses behaviour was very rude if they were not able to satisfy to hold the shift then why they do like that.

Very dissapointing. I brought a friend in to get a stent put in. Before the procedure the medical staff advised the patient to NOT make any important decisions until after 24 hrs had passed because he would be under the influence of anisthetic. While still in recovery two hopital staff (one a nurse) approached his bedside and asked if he would take part in a medical study. The study was to support a multi-million ( or billion) dollar drug company. Why would hospital staff approach an individual, who was told to not make important decisions, if he would volunteer to take part in a medical study (for free) to benefit a multi-million dollar drug company. Is this a breach of patient trust and unethical medical practices?

My wife came to hospital with strong bleeding near 6pm. Already waiting more than 4 hours . There is no answer to the question of what the doctor will not examine. Complete unprofessionalism and contempt for the patient

Terrible. Discharged my elderly grandmother with no discharge papers or instructions. Theft is rampant! My grandmother had a week's worth of clothes, robe, and nightgown stolen! Not to mention a very small amount of petty cash and a rosary! Who steals a rosary! Money is one thing but to take a senior's clothes is downright criminal.

Hello I was here alot as a kid  when my dad was in hospital and I visited alot with my mom and I remember it was 2010 2011 they had a cafeteria till tom hortons took over many year later. But does anyone know the company that ran the cafeteria they had awesome deserts, pizza, my absolute favorite id get like 3 times a week when I was there. Was fries and gravy the gravy was amazing. I just want the recipe or to know if the company still around ill order gravy from it if they have it still. For personal use. Thank you
Our family has been treated well at Seven Oaks ER.  The staff & Dr.'s do their best to help everyones health issues.  Yes, there is a wait but they took great care of us.  Thank you Seven Oaks!

There is no cafeteria open and Tim’s is closed too so I have to go for a walk to find some food.Not the best planning.visitors come on Sunday too.
I don’t think hospitals want visitors any more

My best friend got in a car accident. Got taken here in an ambulance. Is in a neck brace and horrible pain. They gave her an Advil and made her wait FOUR HOURS to even get out of the waiting room. This hospital is a joke.

Right now My husband is at Urgent Care And he is not having a good experience at all This one nurse we feel she is talking down to us and being condescending and not taking the time to listen  to what my husband  needs I dreaded having to leave my husband there alone for overnight A few timesI had to go right out to the nursing station  just to get a nurse to come to my husband's room but over all I know we will not come back to seven oaks hospital if I could give no stars to this hospital I wouldn't 😐☹😖😡😡
Terrible place to spend your dying days. Zero compassion and the management is rude and condescending. A starving dog wouldn't eat their food. I'd give them no stars at all if I could.

Triage nurse incredibly rude, speaks down to people, doesn’t seem interested in helping, she’d rather be rude and disrespectful to those who are sick or in pain. It’s the big heavy lady with the accent fyi

Have been treated both in ER and on the wards... both very satisfactory. Let people complain if they want... it is a public health care system. Or go to the states... get the treatment and pay the bill... then you'll really have something to complain about.

I'm so impressed with the care the staff offered my father of 99 years of age.
I am sorry if others have said bad things but I've only experienced awesome care here and they're sure humane in there care of others in times of need.
The place is clean. I had my abdominal ultrasound done here. Staff were friendly and helpful.
It not urgent care  but can call it more of private clinic where  they have 1 DOCTOR FOR ALL THE PATIENTS  and it takes forever to get the care . PLEASE AVOID THIS URGENT CARE AT ANY COST.
Terrible hospital no one listens or cares about patients. They will also laugh at you when you get frustrated and say I’m going somewhere else they giggle and go buh bye.

Came to urgent care with very sharp pain young lady at the entrance was with  super rude behaviour , the way of asking questions was very very bad .other staff was pretty good dealing but the welcoming girl needs more lessons how to treat with patients .nobody is coming to emergency for fun everyone has some kind of trouble that’s why they came to emergency .

Everyone was rude and seemed to care less about me and other patients. The lady at the E.R. Front desk was rude and obviously not a people person. This hospital is not well maintained or properly staffed. Id rather suffer at home than go wait in Seven Oaks E.R. and get treated by negligent rude people.
Service staff were actually really accommodating. Need an ice pack? Just ask. Respect is mutual and waiting is inevitable.

Went to emerg felling tired, turns out I had CHF and ended up in the hospital for 6 days. The staff right from the second I was admitted to when I left were amazing, helpful and always treated me well.

Triage nurse who first meets you at the emergency doors first didn't listen to anything we had to say and as we were waiting the same nurse made fun of someone not wanting to wait that needed to see a doctor this place is very unprofessional with how they talk about patients in the open
My daughter was crying with abdominal pain but nobody cares , we are waiting 3-4 hours and requesting to staff but nobody cared. Very very Poor system

1) Diagnosed the cause of my main issue. Treated me effectively for this main concern.
2) I & they, while dealing with the main issue, forgot to even look at my injured tongue. I 'm still afraid it's infected. 🙃 …
I noticed improvement in wait times and staff are a lot more compassionate and caring over the years. I do appreciate the services given due to my health conditions.
I forgot to thank Doc Derek from Urgent care who checked my eye earlier. As much I want to give a 5-star rating the waiting time was terrible.
Daughter needed stitches the doctor was very good with her. Took his time and made sure she was not freaking out to much
Asked for a blanket in waiting room was told they don't give them out yet 6 other people have one 👀 …
I found the staff efficient and frendly. The time I spent there was in the I.C.U. and they saved my life. The food is actually served hot.(take note HSC)

Unfortunately we lives near this hospital, that is not a hospital, If you need an immediate response you must call ambulance for an emergency care.. Other wise Seven Oak Hospital simply a waste of time..  So I'm looking for a zero to give to this Harasspital..
Very friendly and helpful staff.
Its a hospital no one wants to be there. But I was lucky and was there for a appointment and the stuff where really kinda and very friendly.
Clean location, easy parking and rapid service from my experience. Staff have always provided good care to me and my family!
Was in and out quickly with 4 stiches. Staff was courteous because I did not act like an a$$ to them.
waited 7 hours just to get anti nauseau pills what a joke
XRay, ECG/EKG , whatever time you go, gets done within minutes. Great. Check pic for timing
I woulde give ZERO star if it was possible. Very poor service. Rude staff! The emergency department is awful and I do not recomend this place to any one.

Thank you to the ER staff , nurses and doctors and ICU nurses for saving my life .
I am forever indebted to them .
Thank you .
Two visits made to date. Medical staff are pleasant and try to be timely.
Terrible, rude staff that didnt care how much pain I was in. Would not recommen coming here for anything.
Waited over 3 hours, wasn't seen. A complete waste of time. Garbage.
Worst hospital in the city. Nurses and doctors don’t care about what they do
Great care recieved here
Waste of time.
Super!
Rudest staff in emergency!
Worst hospital ever.
On October 30, 2024, I came for an x-ray of my hand. I sat in line for 10 minutes. Everything went very quickly and the staff was very polite.

Worst service ever. Doctors are good tho
Worst service in all the hospitals I have been to. Incompetent clerk’s. Laysy and don’t really care. The doctor are amazing tho. The only reason to give a star. It smacks of racism because I come from Quebec
Not very fast, but good enough, I advise you to seek urgent help
